questions.question: Anything ............................... he says is bound to be scandalous.
questions.description: That is a relative pronoun like which. It can refer to both people and things. It acts as the subject or object of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: ............................... she should forget me so quickly was rather a shock.
questions.description: That is a relative pronoun like which. It can refer to both people and things. It acts as the subject or object of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: She married an actor ................................. you may have heard of.
questions.description: That is a relative pronoun like which. It can refer to both people and things. It acts as the subject or object of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: I have not got anything ................................... belongs to you.
questions.description: That is a relative pronoun like which. It can refer to both people and things. It acts as the subject or object of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: .................................... cannot be cured must be endured.
The only thing .................................. matters is to be true to yourself.
questions.description: That is a relative pronoun like which. It can refer to both people and things. It acts as the subject or object of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: It is the best film ................................. I have seen.
questions.description: That is a relative pronoun like which. It can refer to both people and things. It acts as the subject or object of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: All ……………………….. he says is certainly true.
questions.description: That is a relative pronoun like which. It can refer to both people and things. It acts as the subject or object of the verb in the relative clause.
